Sentence: He (Christ) thinks of Betty, who always provided order
Confused and irritated when he (Christ) goes to Betty's apartment, his (Christ) tongue turns into a ', "``fat thumb''  (Betty)', 'and he (Christ) has difficulty speaking
He (Christ) thinks about how Betty had accepted his (Christ) marriage proposition two months earlier, and how he (Christ) had guiltlessly avoided her (Betty) thereafter
Betty says she (Betty) loves him (Christ), and he (Christ) admits he (Christ) loves her (Betty)
She (Betty) tells him (Christ) to leave her (Betty) alone, as he (Christ) has made her (Betty) feel bad
